thread.title: Gurdaspur terrorists planned to attack more places
thread.title_full: Gurdaspur terrorists planned to attack more places - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Gurdaspur terrorists planned to attack more places
text:
GURDASPUR/NEW DELHI: The three terrorists, who struck at several places in Punjab's Gurdaspur on Monday, had plans to attack more places including the Civil Lines area in the district headquarter town besides Dina Nagar police station, investigators said on Tuesday.
The Global Positioning System (GPS) devices the terrorists were carrying were switched on after they crossed into India from Pakistan, probably through a canal of the Ravi river, sources said.
The Ravi flows down from Himachal Pradesh to the Jammu border before entering Punjab at Madhopur. It criss-crosses the India-Pakistan border three times before finally flowing into Pakistan ahead of Gurudaspur and merges with Chenab river.
READ ALSO: GPS recovered from dead terrorists points to Pakistan angle
As the currents were very strong, security agencies believe they used one of the canals to enter India and then switched on the two GPS devices, which were recovered from the encounter site at Dina Nagar on Monday.
The tracking point on one of the devices showed Talwandi point, Parmanand village and Dina Nagar, while the other had Gurudaspur Civil Lines marked, indicating that the area was also their target.
READ ALSO: Gurdaspur bus driver saved many lives
The 15km stretch from the point they crossed over into India at Bamiyal was covered by the terrorists on foot before they planted five improvised explosive devices (IEDs) on Talwandi-Amritsar railway track, they said. A night vision device has also been recovered from the railway track, sources said.
State police chief Sumedh Saini said grenades with "Made in China" markings were recovered from the terrorists who were killed in retaliatory action by the Punjab Police commandos. http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/followceleb.cms?alias=Pubjab Terror Attack,Gurdaspur Terrorist Attack,Gurdaspur Attackers Plan,Gurdaspur Attack Probe Stay updated on the go with Times of India News App. Click here to download it for your device.
